plot_recom: Visualize Ocean Currents and Wind from NetCDF Data

plot_recom.Rd

Reads a NetCDF file containing ocean current and wind data, extracts relevant variables at a specified depth (-2.35m), and generates time-series and spatial plots. Highlights slack current time and visualizes magnitude and direction of currents and wind.

Usage

plot_recom(
  nc_file = "/Users/rof011/GBR_connectivity/Oceanparcels/Moore_uv_2015-12-05.nc",
  parcels_reefs = sf::st_read("/Users/rof011/GBR_connectivity/inputs/Moore_2D.gpkg",
    quiet = TRUE),
  parcels_polygon =
    dplyr::filter(sf::st_read("/Users/rof011/GBR_connectivity/inputs/Moore_2D.gpkg",
    quiet = TRUE), site_id == "Moore_16071_Slope_39a")
)

Arguments

nc_file

Character. Path to the NetCDF file containing oceanographic data.

parcels_reefs

sf object. Spatial dataset of reef locations.

parcels_polygon

sf object. Spatial dataset for a specific study site polygon.

Value

A combined ggplot object displaying temporal trends of ocean currents and wind, along with spatial maps of current speeds at the slack current time.
